html.p: This app was created to aid in onboarding new data into Splunk. It includes some searches and forms that are help you get a better idea of how data is coming into Splunk, and where it is going.
Note: Many of these searches require access to the _internal index. It is meant to be used by admins.
Runs a search to show the difference between the time an event occurred (according to the timestamp of the event) and the time Splunk indexed the event.
Lists the sourcetypes collected by host. Also includes a list of the indexes in which the host is found.
Lists the hosts and number of events for the selected sourcetype.
Lists the sourcetypes found in each index.
Lists the source (filenames) from which a host is monitoring events.
Shows the sourcetypes found in the data model acceleration data.
Runs a data model search for the selected data model and object.
Lists the architecture, OS and version of the forwarders sending data into Splunk.
